prickle.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a long thin sharp point on the skin of some animals or the surface of some plants
prickle.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if you feel a prickle of fear, anger, or excitement, you feel slightly afraid, angry, or excited in a way that makes your skin feel slightly cold and uncomfortable
prickle.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: She felt a prickle of fear as she realized that she was alone.
prickle.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if something prickles your skin, it makes it sting slightly
prickle.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: A cold breeze prickled his face.
He felt sweat prickle on his forehead.
prickle.translation[1].definitions[1].de: if your skin prickles, it begins to sting slightly
prickle.translation[1].definitions[2].de: if your eyes prickle, they sting slightly because you are going to cry
prickle.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: She felt her eyes prickle. ‘It was awful, ’ she whispered.
prickle.translation[1].definitions[3].de: if you prickle, you feel slightly angry, excited, or afraid
prickle.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: The thought of meeting him made her prickle with excitement.
She felt herself prickle  (=become angry) at his tone of voice.
